No bail for 4 men charged in alleged rape at UMass dorm

Judge Mary Hurley said the alleged attack at the UMass Amherst campus is the worst assault she's heard of in her career as a judge. (Boston Globe, 4:39 p.m.)

CDC: 12 more people infected with fungal meningitis linked to Mass. pharmacy

The new cases bring the total number of meningitis cases tied to a Framingham pharmacy to 294, health officials said. (Boston Globe, 3:10 p.m.)

Expect President Obama and Mitt Romney to supercharge their ground games in an effort to close the deal with voters over the next two weeks. (AP, 2:37 p.m.)

Trick or treat? Forecasters say another Halloween storm possible

A system forming well off the southern coast of Cuba could move up the east coast and pummel New England with heavy rain, forecasters said. (Globe, 3:20 p.m.)

Boston officials seek to convert Marshall Elementary into a charter school

Health & Wellness

Earlier puberty seen in boys

Researchers found signs of puberty in American boys up to two years earlier than previously reported. Other studies have suggested that girls, too, are entering puberty younger.

Wis. gunman in salon attack had history of abuse

Radcliffe Franklin Haughton, who is accused of opening fire at the salon where his wife worked, killing three and wounding four, slashed his wife’s tires weeks earlier, police said.
